Implement a JavaScript function that accepts a string as input and returns the reversed version of the string.
PLAINFORMAT

Implementing a JavaScript function to reverse a string is straightforward. Here's a simple way to do it:

```javascript
function reverseString(str) {
    return str.split('').reverse().join('');
}
```

This function works by first splitting the input string into an array of characters using the `split('')` method. Then, it reverses the array using the `reverse()` method. Finally, it joins the reversed array back into a string using the `join('')` method.

You can test this function with any string, like this:

```javascript
console.log(reverseString("hello")); // Outputs: "olleh"
```

This should give you the reversed version of the input string. If you have any other questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
